message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can arrive at the two structures in the photo using only the block‐dictionary pieces (and without reorienting them). 

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Overall there are TWO separate builds:

  A) Left “House”‐Like Structure  
     – 5 total blocks  
     – 4 layers from bottom to top:  
       1) Two tall green columns standing upright  
       2) A single yellow rectangular beam spanning across the top of the green columns  
       3) A red arch block perched above the yellow beam  
       4) An orange “roof” wedge resting on the red arch

  B) Right “Archway Complex”  
     – 8 total blocks  
     – Effectively 2 layers in front plus a row of taller blocks behind:  
       •  Front Row: Two red arches (side by side) on the ground, with two yellow half‐cylinders on top  
       •  Behind/Between the arches: Two shorter green blocks and two tall yellow columns, arranged alternately (green‐yellow‐yellow‐green) from left to right  

•  In total, the scene uses 13 blocks.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

A)  Left House‐Like Structure (5 blocks)
   1. Two tall green columns (use block #3 twice)  
   2. One yellow horizontal rectangular beam (use block #6)  
   3. One red arch block (use block #1)  
   4. One orange wedge for the roof (use block #15)

B)  Right Archway Complex (8 blocks)
   1. Two red arch blocks (block #1 used twice more)  
   2. Two yellow half‐cylinders (block #11, used two times)  
   3. Two shorter green upright blocks (block #5, used two times)  
   4. Two tall yellow columns (block #9, used two times)

Remember that none of these blocks may be rotated beyond how they appear in the dictionary.  Where we list the same index multiple times, it means physically reusing that same model/orientation from the dictionary.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1: Move block with index 3         // Place first green column (left structure)  
  Step2: Move block with index 3         // Place second green column (left structure)  
  Step3: Move block with index 6         // Span the yellow beam across the columns  
  Step4: Move block with index 1         // Red arch block on top of the beam  
  Step5: Move block with index 15        // Orange wedge roof on top  

  Step6: Move block with index 1         // First red arch (right structure, front row, left side)  
  Step7: Move block with index 1         // Second red arch (right structure, front row, right side)  
  Step8: Move block with index 11        // First yellow half‐cylinder (on top of left red arch)  
  Step9: Move block with index 11        // Second yellow half‐cylinder (on top of right red arch)  

  Step10: Move block with index 5        // Place left green block behind arcs  
  Step11: Move block with index 9        // Tall yellow column next to that green block  
  Step12: Move block with index 9        // Second tall yellow column toward the right  
  Step13: Move block with index 5        // Final green block on the far right
}

That sequence places all 13 blocks in an order that reproduces the target scene exactly as shown.
